value.content:

value.title: GoTo’s profit claim doesn’t add up: Adjusted metrics mask a US$15.6M loss
value.content:
Indonesian tech giant GoTo Group has reported a statutory loss of US$15.6 million (Rp255 billion) for the third quarter of 2025, despite the company’s press release proclaiming it had achieved its “first quarterly adjusted pre-tax profit”. value.content:

value.title: Why startups shouldn’t reinvent the wheel for MVP launches
value.content:

value.title: Unlocking Asia’s payments potential: The case for unifying fragmented policies
value.content:
Asia’s digital and real-time payments market is one of the most dynamic in the world, but also one of the most fragmented. Each economy has developed its own payment systems, so the adoption curve and rate vary greatly. Few links exist across borders, and this patchwork creates barriers to scale and reduces the ability of consumers […]

value.title: A new ocean order: What startups and investors need to know about the High Seas Treaty
value.content:
For centuries, the high seas — covering nearly half our planet — were a lawless expanse. Beyond any nation’s control, this “Wild West” of the oceans was a free-for-all for fishing fleets, energy prospectors, and bioprospectors. Only 1.5 per cent of these waters were protected. That era is ending. On 17 January 2026, the High […]

value.title: From heatstroke to haze: India’s climate vulnerability is sparking a new wave of investment
value.content:
